Hi,
         I've never heard of it, but an obvious interpretation springs from 
the name...

         What it sounds like, is a neurone with some "memory" in that it 
keeps a variable from update to update, and its update function would look 
something like:

         var' = var * f + weighted_sum(input);           f < 1.0

         So var integrates input across updates, and f acts to slowly leak 
away the old contents...

         whether the output is var itself or f(var) is, I guess, your choice...

         Ian

p.s. presumably you can built one of these from a few standard neurones?

At 22:42 27/10/2004 +0000, you wrote:


>hi all,
>I'm starting to get into working with NEAT, and I was just wondering
>if anyone had any links to anything about the leaky integrator
>neuron, as I'm having a hard time finding any useful information,
>aside from that it useful in generating oscilliatory behavior.
>thanks,
>David
